description: Domain-anchored learning backlog - domain drift prevented via domain_anchor.py scoring

tasks.description: Research: Rx + WPF data binding synchronization patterns
tasks.reason: Bridges Rx streams with WPF UI binding for reactive data flow. Essential for implementing Tickblaze's real-time market data updates directly to UI. Connects LEARN-007 Rx patterns with WPF rendering.

tasks.description: Research: WPF UI virtualization techniques for large datasets
tasks.reason: DynamicData research mentioned virtualization operators and VirtualizingPanel for 10,000+ item collections. Understanding proper implementation of UI virtualization extends reactive collection knowledge into rendering optimization critical for trading platform performance. Connects to LEARN-027 reactive collections.

tasks.description: Research: WPF Dispatcher and thread affinity for UI Automation
tasks.reason: WeakEventManager uses read/write locks for thread safety. Understanding Dispatcher threading model is critical for WPF testing where automation runs on different threads than UI.

tasks.description: Research: UI Automation (UIA) event monitoring with AccEvent tool for testing dynamic content in WPF applications
tasks.reason: Bridges gap in automated accessibility testing (30-40% coverage requiring manual work); critical for WPF trading platforms with live data streams. Mentioned 3+ times in WinAppDriver/Axe.Windows research as necessary for dynamic content validation. Domain anchor score: 10/10 (core: UI Automation, WPF, testing).

tasks.description: Research: WinAppDriver integration with Axe.Windows for accessibility testing automation
tasks.reason: Mentioned as recommended approach for driving Windows application state during Axe.Windows accessibility scans in CI/CD pipelines. Bridges automated testing (FlaUI/WinAppDriver) with accessibility compliance. Essential for implementing automated accessibility regression testing in Tickblaze.
tasks.domain_score: 10/10 - Strong core domain relevance (automation + accessibility testing)

tasks.description: Research: WPF UI Automation thread affinity and synchronization
tasks.reason: Thread affinity enforcement is a core concept in WPF Dispatcher research, and UI Automation must also respect thread affinity when querying or manipulating UI elements from test automation

Recommended as best solution for high-speed property updates in trading apps, mentioned as 30-60Hz natural frequency, directly applicable to Tickblaze, fills gap in understanding how to implement properly with thread safety

tasks.description: Research: AutomationPeer custom implementation patterns for WPF controls
tasks.reason: Core to event raising and UI Automation support - OnCreateAutomationPeer, pattern implementation, and ListenerExists optimization mentioned throughout AccEvent research

tasks.description: Research: WPF Dispatcher priority and threading models for real-time market data updates
tasks.reason: GC tuning research mentioned thread isolation and dispatcher queue monitoring as critical for real-time WPF, and trading apps need coordinated UI updates during market data floods

tasks.description: Research: CPU Affinity and Thread Scheduling Optimization for Low-Latency Systems
tasks.reason: Critical gap: implementation of CPU pinning and cache locality for lock-free patterns. Essential for extracting full performance from application-level optimizations in real trading systems. [Domain score: 6/10 - related via performance optimization for trading]

tasks.description: Research: .NET Garbage Collection tuning for low-latency WPF applications
tasks.reason: Lock-free ring buffers and CPU affinity research mentions GC pauses as latency killers (pre-allocate memory, no GC). Understanding Server vs Workstation GC modes, background GC, LOH compaction, and GCLatencyMode settings is critical for optimizing Tickblaze WPF trading platform performance. Direct connection to existing WPF and low-latency research.

tasks.description: Research: PerfView and ETW event tracing for WPF applications
tasks.reason: GC tuning research heavily referenced ETW events for measuring pause times (26μs suspension, 4.8ms collection, 21μs resumption). PerfView provides ground truth for GC behavior, memory allocation, and rendering performance. Essential measurement tool that enables validation of ALL WPF performance optimizations.
tasks.domain_score: 8/10 - Core domain (essential measurement tool for WPF trading performance)

tasks.description: Research: WPF visual tree optimization techniques and complexity reduction
tasks.reason: PerfView research identified visual tree complexity as consuming 70% of performance budget (70ms in 100ms target). This is a core WPF performance bottleneck directly relevant to Tickblaze trading UI.

tasks.description: Research: WeakEventManager patterns and memory leak prevention in WPF
tasks.reason: Mentioned repeatedly in visual tree optimization - provides 15-30% memory reduction and prevents common event handler leaks. Critical for long-running WPF applications.
tasks.domain_score: 9/10 - Core domain (WPF memory management, testing long-running apps)

tasks.description: Research: WPF DependencyProperty optimization patterns (validation callbacks, coercion, Freezable objects)
tasks.reason: CPU affinity research mentions cache-line awareness and memory access patterns. DependencyProperty callbacks execute on every property change in WPF data binding - understanding optimization patterns (avoiding validation in hot paths, freezing Freezable objects, coercion vs validation) directly impacts Tickblaze UI responsiveness during high-frequency market data updates. Core WPF performance primitive.

tasks.description: Research: WPF resource dictionary optimization and StaticResource vs DynamicResource performance
tasks.reason: Freezable XAML pattern showed PresentationOptions:Freeze with StaticResource usage - need to understand when StaticResource vs DynamicResource impacts performance, especially for frozen Freezable objects in trading platform themes
tasks.domain_score: 10/10 - Strong core domain relevance (WPF + performance optimization)

tasks.description: Research: Research: WPF PresentationOptions:Freeze implementation and compile-time resource freezing patterns
tasks.reason: Mentioned in LEARN-045 and LEARN-046 as critical for freezing Freezable objects in XAML (212 bytes vs 972 bytes memory savings). Required for DynamicResource with Brushes to prevent unfrozen resource bugs. Direct compile-time technique for enforcing immutability and thread safety.
tasks.domain_score: 10/10 - Strong core domain relevance (WPF + performance optimization)
